intro: Hypolepis pedropaloensis, commonly known as the Pedropalo fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Davalliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinnately divided fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
